import { Invert, FullScreenCode, Appear, Split } from "mdx-deck"
import { hack, swiss } from 'mdx-deck/themes'
import { deep } from "@theme-ui/presets"
import { Flex, Close, Spinner, Button, Box, Heading } from '@theme-ui/components'
import Newsletter from "./Newsletter" 
import Header from "./header"
import Center from "./center"
import myTheme from "./theme"
AKA what I have been waiting for...
Theme-UI Is not a CSS in JS Library
In fact its built on top of Emotion!
Theme-UI is complete library built around creating themeable components.
It provides you a system for creating themes, and components that can be driven by them.

<Header>
  Where does the power come from?
</Header>
Theme-UI uses the new context API to automagically feed your theme to your components, and third party components built with theme ui.
Theme UI has an optional Package of Components.
It includes stuff like Inputs, Buttons, Loading Spinners, and much more!
Styling these components is very easy!
They are styled right on the theme object.
These components can be used to build bigger, more complicated themeable components.
You can define responsive styles just by using arrays!
You can also define your own breakpoints!

scopeImports: import { Invert, FullScreenCode, Appear, Split } from "mdx-deck"
import { Flex, Close, Spinner, Button, Box, Heading } from '@theme-ui/components'

}; const layoutProps = { theme, _frontmatter }; const MDXLayout = "wrapper" export default function MDXContent({ components, ...props }) { return
Theme-UI

{`AKA what I have been waiting for...`}

{`About Me`}

  • {`Self-taught `}
  • {`JAMstack Developer `}
  • {`Bootcamp Mentor `}
  • {`JAMstack Phoenix Host`}
What is Theme-UI?
What Theme-UI isn't

{`Theme-UI Is not a CSS in JS Library`}

üë©‚Äçüé§üíÑüíÖ

{`In fact its built on top of Emotion! `}

üë©‚Äçüé§
What Theme-UI is
  • {`Theme-UI is complete library built around creating themeable components. `}
  • {`It provides you a system for creating themes, and components that can be driven by them.`}
  • {`It calls itself a mini-framework`}
What do themes look like?

{`Simple Javascript Objects.`}

{`export default {
  colors: {
    text: '#000',
    background: '#fff',
    primary: '#33e',
  },
  ...
}
`}
Where does the power come from?

{`React Context +`}

{` `}{`Using Tokens & SX Prop`}

{`Theme-UI uses the new context API to automagically feed your theme to your components, and third party components built with theme ui.`}

{`export const theme = {
    colors: {
        primary: 'blue',
        secondary: 'red',
    }
}

export const Component = () => (

)


// layout.js
import { ThemeProvider } from 'theme-ui'
import theme from './theme'
export default props => (
  {props.children}
)
`}
Theme Components

{`Theme UI has an optional Package of Components. `}

{`It includes stuff like Inputs, Buttons, Loading Spinners, and much more!`}

Styling Theme Components
  • {`Styling these components is very easy! `}
  • {`They are styled right on the theme object.`}
  • {`These components can be used to build bigger, more complicated themeable components. `}
Components can define variants 
{`

`}

{`Defining Variants`}

{`export default {
  buttons: {
    primary: {
      backgroundColor: "primary",
      padding: 4,
      margin: 4
    },
    secondary: {
      backgroundColor: "secondary",
      padding: 2,
      margin: 2
    }
  }
  ...
}
`}
Creating Components 
{`const Header = ({ children }) => (
   \`1px solid \${theme.colors.primary}\`
    }}
  >
    {children}
  
);
`}
Break Points!

{`You can define responsive styles just by using arrays!`}

{`{
    fontSize: ['10px', '20px', '30px']
    color: ['green', 'red', 'blue']
}
`}

{`You can also define your own breakpoints!`}

Even styles MDX! 
{`  styles: {
    h1: {
      fontSize: 32,
      fontFamily: 'heading',
      fontWeight: 'heading',
      color: 'primary',
      mt: 4,
      mb: 2,
    },
  }
}
`}
; } ; MDXContent.isMDXComponent = true;
